article_title: After 7 Years of Slow Growth, U.S. Now Sees More of Same
article_text:
Economists, business executives and American workers have waited a long time for the U.S. to shake off its postrecession hangover. Robust growth often seemed right around the corner—maybe next quarter, maybe next year.

Not anymore.

Most Federal Reserve policy makers and private forecasters are giving up on the long-awaited breakout and...

article_metadata.article.origheadline: After 7 Years of Slow Growth, U.S. Now Sees More of Same

article_summary:
Robust growth often seemed right around the corner—maybe next quarter, maybe next year.
Economists, business executives and American workers have waited a long time for the U.S. to shake off its postrecession hangover.
Most Federal Reserve policy makers and private forecasters are giving up on the long-awaited breakout and...
Not anymore.
